text: Control of NF-kappa B activity by the <extra_id_0> I kappa B beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibitor .
The transcription factor NF-kappa B is maintained in an inactive cytoplasmic state by I kappa B inhibitors .

In mammalian cells , <extra_id_0> I kappa B alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> I kappa B beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins have been purified and shown to be the inhibitors of NF-kappa B through their association with the <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> subunits .
